description: Capt. Pike is held prisoner and tested by aliens who have the power to project incredibly lifelike illusions.
title: The Cage

description: Dr. McCoy discovers his old flame is not what she seems after crew members begin dying from a sudden lack of salt in their bodies.
title: The Man Trap

description: Captain Kirk must learn the limits to the power of a 17-year-old boy with the psychic ability to create anything and destroy anyone.
title: Charlie X

description: The flight recorder of the 200-year-old U.S.S. Valiant relays a tale of terror--a magnetic storm at the edge of the galaxy!
title: Where No Man Has Gone Before

description: The crew is infected with a mysterious disease that removes people's emotional inhibitions to a dangerous degree.
title: The Naked Time

description: A transporter malfunction splits Captain Kirk into two halves: one meek and indecisive, the other violent and ill tempered. The remaining crew members stranded on the planet cannot be beamed up to the ship until a the problem is fixed.
title: The Enemy Within

description: The Enterprise picks up untrustworthy entrepreneur Harry Mudd accompanied by three beautiful women who immediately put a spell on all the male crew members.
title: Mudd's Women

description: Nurse Chapel is reunited with her fiancé; but his new obsession leads him to make an android duplicate of Captain Kirk.
title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?

description: The Enterprise discovers a planet exactly like Earth, but the only inhabitants are children who contract a fatal disease upon entering puberty.
title: Miri

description: Kirk and psychiatrist Helen Noel are trapped on a maximum security penal colony that experiments with mind control and Spock must use the Vulcan mind-meld to find a way to save them.
title: Dagger of the Mind

description: After the Enterprise is forced to destroy a dangerous marker buoy, a gigantic alien ship arrives to capture and condemn the crew as trespassers.
title: The Corbomite Maneuver

description: Spock kidnaps the crippled Capt. Pike, hijacks the Enterprise and then surrenders for court martial.
title: The Menagerie: Part I

description: At Spock's court martial, he explains himself with mysterious footage about when Capt. Pike was kidnapped by powerful illusion casting aliens.
title: The Menagerie: Part II

description: While Captain Kirk investigates whether an actor is actually a presumed dead mass murderer, a mysterious assailant is killing the people who could identify the fugitive.
title: The Conscience of the King

description: The Enterprise must decide on its response when a Romulan ship makes a destructively hostile armed probe of Federation territory.
title: Balance of Terror

description: The past three months has left the crew of the Enterprise exhausted and in desperate need of a break, but does this explain McCoy's encounter with a human-sized white rabbit or Kirk crossing paths with the prankster who plagued his days at Starfleet Academy?
title: Shore Leave

description: The Galileo, under Spock's command, crash-lands on a hostile planet. As the Enterprise races against time to find the shuttlecraft, Spock's strictly logical leadership clashes with the fear and resentment of his crew.
title: The Galileo Seven

description: A being that controls matter and creates planets wants to play with the Enterprise crew.
title: The Squire of Gothos

description: For bringing hostility into their solar system, a superior alien race brings Captain Kirk in mortal combat against the reptilian captain of an alien ship he was pursuing.
title: Arena

description: The Enterprise is thrown back in time to 1960s Earth.
title: Tomorrow Is Yesterday

description: Kirk draws a court martial in the negligent death of a crewman.
title: Court Martial

description: Seeking the answer to a century-old mystery, Kirk and crew encounter a vacantly peaceful society under a 6000-year autocratic rule that kills all those it can't absorb.
title: The Return of the Archons

description: While on patrol in deep space, Captain Kirk and his crew find and revive a genetically engineered world conqueror and his compatriots from Earth's 20th century.
title: Space Seed

description: Kirk and Spock must save their ship's crew when they are declared all killed in action in a bizarre computer simulated war where the actual deaths must occur to continue.
title: A Taste of Armageddon

description: The Enterprise investigates a planet whose colonists should be dead, but are not.
title: This Side of Paradise

description: The Enterprise is sent to a mining colony that is being terrorized by a mysterious monster.
title: The Devil in the Dark

description: With a war with Klingons raging, Kirk and Spock attempt to resist an occupation of a planet with incomprehensibly placid natives.
title: Errand of Mercy

description: Existence itself comes under threat from a man's power-struggle with his alternate self, with the Enterprise's strained dilithium crystals presenting his key to a final solution.
title: The Alternative Factor

description: When a temporarily insane Dr. McCoy accidentally changes history and destroys his time, Kirk and Spock follow him to prevent the disaster, but the price to do so is high.
title: The City on the Edge of Forever

description: The Enterprise crew attempts to stop a plague of amoeba-like creatures from possessing human hosts and spreading throughout the galaxy.
title: Operation -- Annihilate!

description: In the throes of his Pon Farr mating period, Spock must return to Vulcan to meet his intended future wife, betrothed from childhood.
title: Amok Time

description: A powerful being claiming to be the Greek god Apollo appears and demands that the crew of the Enterprise disembark onto his planet to worship him.
title: Who Mourns for Adonais?

description: A powerful artificially intelligent Earth probe, with a murderously twisted imperative, comes aboard the Enterprise and confuses Capt. Kirk as his creator.
title: The Changeling

description: A transporter accident places Capt. Kirk's landing party in an alternate universe, where the Federation is a barbarically brutal empire.
title: Mirror, Mirror

description: Primitive inhabitants of Gamma Trianguli VI worship a God who orders them to kill visitors, from the Enterprise.
title: The Apple

description: The USS Enterprise encounters the wrecked USS Constellation and its distraught captain who's determined to stop the giant planet-destroying robot ship that killed his crew.
title: The Doomsday Machine

description: Very alien visitors to our galaxy attempt to connect with human consciousness but miss, winding up tapping into the regions of human nightmares instead.
title: Catspaw

description: Harry Mudd returns with a plot to take over the Enterprise by stranding the crew on a planet populated by androids under his command.
title: I, Mudd

description: While returning to the Enterprise aboard the shuttlecraft, Kirk, Spock, McCoy and a seriously ill Federation diplomat find themselves kidnapped by an energized cloud.
title: Metamorphosis

description: The Enterprise hosts a number of quarrelling diplomats, including Spock's father, but someone on board has murder in mind.
title: Journey to Babel

description: The Federation clashes with the Klingon Empire over mining rights to Capella IV. A sudden coup between its warrior-minded inhabitants forces Kirk's party to flee with the now dead leader's pregnant wife.
title: Friday's Child

description: A landing party from the Enterprise is exposed to strange form of radiation which rapidly ages them.
title: The Deadly Years

description: Capt. Kirk obsessively hunts for a mysterious cloud creature he encountered in his youth.
title: Obsession

description: Kirk and the Enterprise Computer become detectives after Scotty is accused of murdering women on a pleasure planet.
title: Wolf in the Fold

description: To protect a space station with a vital grain shipment, Kirk must deal with Federation bureaucrats, a Klingon battle cruiser and a peddler who sells furry, purring, hungry little creatures as pets.
title: The Trouble with Tribbles

description: Kirk, Uhura and Chekov are trapped on a planet where abducted aliens are enslaved and trained to perform as gladiators for the amusement of bored, faceless aliens.
title: The Gamesters of Triskelion

description: The crew of Enterprise struggles to cope with a planet of imitative people who have modeled their society on 1920's gangsters.
title: A Piece of the Action

description: The Enterprise encounters a gigantic energy draining space organism that threatens the galaxy.
title: The Immunity Syndrome

description: Peaceful, primitive peoples get caught up in the struggle between superpowers, with Kirk unhappily trying to restore the balance of power disrupted by the Klingons.
title: A Private Little War

description: The Enterprise is guided to a distant, long-dead world where survivors of an extremely ancient race - existing only as disembodied energy - desiring the bodies of Kirk, Spock and astro-biologist Ann Mulhall so that they may live again.
title: Return to Tomorrow

description: Looking for a missing Federation cultural observer, Kirk and Spock find themselves on a planet whose culture has been completely patterned after Earth's 1944 Nazi society.
title: Patterns of Force

description: Galactic alien scouts capture the Enterprise for a return voyage and a prelude to invasion. Kirk's one advantage - they're not used to their adopted human form.
title: By Any Other Name

description: Responding to a distress signal, Kirk finds Captain Tracey of the U.S.S. Exeter violating the prime directive and interfering with a war between the Yangs and the Kohms to find the secret of their longevity.
title: The Omega Glory

description: Kirk and a sub-skeleton crew are ordered to test out an advanced artificially intelligent control system - the M-5 Multitronic system, which could potentially render them all redundant. Star fleet is very optimistic, but, Kirk fears - even in a testing situation - removing humans from the equation is a very dangerous position to be left in. A position of life or death.
title: The Ultimate Computer

description: The Enterprise crew investigates the disappearance of a ship's crew on a planet that is a modern version of the Roman Empire.
title: Bread and Circuses

description: While back in time observing Earth in 1968, the Enterprise crew encounters the mysterious Gary Seven who has his own agenda on the planet.
title: Assignment: Earth

description: The crew of the Enterprise pursues a mysterious woman who has abducted Spock's brain.
title: Spock's Brain

description: An apparently insane Capt. Kirk has the Enterprise deliberately enter the Romulan Neutral Zone where the ship is immediately captured by the enemy.
title: The Enterprise Incident

description: Trapped on a planet whose inhabitants are descended from Northwestern American Indians, Kirk loses his memory and is proclaimed a God while the crippled Enterprise races back to the planet before it is destroyed by an asteroid.
title: The Paradise Syndrome

description: The Enterprise reaches a Federation colony where the adults have all killed themselves but the children play without care.
title: And the Children Shall Lead

description: Lovely telepath Miranda is aide to Ambassador Kollos, in a box to stop insanity when humans see Medusans. She rejects Larry, a designer of Enterprise, and senses murderous intent nearby.
title: Is There in Truth No Beauty?

description: As punishment for ignoring their warning and trespassing on their planet, the Melkot condemn Capt. Kirk and his landing party to the losing side of a surreal recreation of the 1881 historic gunfight at the OK Corral.
title: Spectre of the Gun

description: Both humans and Klingons have been lured to a planet by a formless entity that feeds on hatred and has set about to fashion them into a permanent food supply for itself.
title: Day of the Dove

description: The Enterprise discovers an apparent asteroid that is on a collision course with a planet is actually an ancient populated generation ship.
title: For the World Is Hollow and I Have Touched the Sky

description: While Capt. Kirk and the derelict USS Defiant apparently lost, the Enterprise grapples with an insanity causing plague and an attack by the Tholians.
title: The Tholian Web

description: After Dr. McCoy helps the leader of a planet populated by people with powerful psionic abilities, they decide to force him to stay by torturing his comrades until he submits.
title: Plato's Stepchildren

description: A group of aliens who exist in a state of incredible acceleration invade the Enterprise and abduct Capt. Kirk.
title: Wink of an Eye

description: Trapped in an alien laboratory Kirk, Spock and McCoy meet an empath and are involved in a series of experiments.
title: The Empath

description: While transporting an arrogant, demanding princess for a political marriage, Captain Kirk must cope both with her biochemical ability to force him to love her and sabotage on his ship.
title: Elaan of Troyius

description: Kirk and Spock are taken prisoners by a former starship captain named Garth, who now resides at, and has taken over, a high security asylum for the criminally insane.
title: Whom Gods Destroy

description: The Enterprise encounters two duo-chromatic and mutually belligerent aliens who put the ship in the middle of their old conflict.
title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield

description: Kirk beams down to the planet Gideon and appears to find himself trapped on a deserted Enterprise. Spock on the real Enterprise must use his diplomatic skills to deal with the uncooperative inhabitants of Gideon and find the Captain.
title: The Mark of Gideon

description: After the Enterprise landing party beams down to investigate a geologically interesting planet, their ship is hurled across the galaxy. Kirk and company find a deserted outpost guarded by the deadly image of a beautiful woman.
title: That Which Survives

description: A mysterious, twinkling mass of sapient energy ravages an important archive and Scotty's new girlfriend may be linked to it.
title: The Lights of Zetar

description: On a planet, looking for an urgent medicinal cure, Kirk, Spock and McCoy come across a dignified recluse living privately but in splendor with his sheltered ward and a very protective robot servant.
title: Requiem for Methuselah

description: A group of idealistic hippies, led by an irrational leader, come aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise.
title: The Way to Eden

description: Kirk and Spock are caught up in a revolution on a planet where intellectuals and artists live on a utopian city in the sky while the rest of the population toils in mines on the barren surface below.
title: The Cloud Minders

description: Kirk, Spock, Abraham Lincoln and Vulcan legend Surak are pitted in battle against notorious villains from history for the purpose of helping a conscious rock creature's understanding of a concept he does not understand, "good vs. evil".
title: The Savage Curtain

description: When Kirk, Spock and McCoy investigate the disappearance of a doomed planet's population, they find themselves trapped in different periods of that world's past.
title: All Our Yesterdays

description: An insane woman forcibly switches personalities with Capt. Kirk.
title: Turnabout Intruder

description: Capt. Pike is held prisoner and tested by aliens who have the power to project incredibly lifelike illusions.
title: The Cage

description: Dr. McCoy discovers his old flame is not what she seems after crew members begin dying from a sudden lack of salt in their bodies.
title: The Man Trap
